title: Board of Control for Cricket in India
summary: The Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) is the governing body for cricket in India and is under the jurisdiction of Ministry of Youth Affairs and Sports, Government of India.[4]  It is an autonomous organisation and does not come under National sports federation of India. [5][6]The board was formed in December 1928 as a society, registered under the Tamil Nadu Societies Registration Act. BCCI is an autonomous body and does not review any grantsor fundings from Sports ministry of India. [7]It is a consortium of state cricket associations and the state associations select their representatives who in turn elect the BCCI Chief. Its headquarters is located at Wankhede Stadium in Mumbai, Maharashtra. Grant Govan was its first president and Anthony De Mello was first secretary.[8]
